one (even weak) chain lightning on that stage i tested pretty much wiped out 
everyone. slowed down my comp a little, but didn't crash it. i think 1 druid 
survived.


----Original Message Follows----
Other notes: 300 (experience level 9) druids around do not
significantly produce more fearies than 150 (experience level 9)
druids.  The only thing is the druids block the path of faeries when I
use a thief to taunt them.  I haven't tried using a soldier or an
archer to beat the scenario I am playing around with.  What I am
trying to produce is a way for non-Archmages and non-Thieves to gain
lots of experience.  I use slimes to give Archmages lots of experience
and I use tents to give thieves lots of experience.

Here's another thought: what if we could, when creating a scenario,
specify what abilities opponents could and could not use.  That way I
could put a high level mage around, but take away the ability to
freeze time.  Or put a high-level archmage around, and prevent him
from accessing chain-lightning.
